text:
You close the case file. The report is impeccable. The logic is flawless.

Mass hysteria. Infrasound hallucinations. Carbon monoxide poisoning.

You explained the impossible away. You beat the darkness back with a clipboard and a refusal to blink.

You pack your bags. You drive away.

You live a long, normal life. You pay your taxes. You walk your dog.

But you never sleep with the lights off again.

And sometimes, when the wind hits the telephone wires just right, you can hear them singing.

You turn up the radio. You drown it out.

But you hear it.
